line.comment: * AI will frequently build a new station with their resources. The process is instantaneous, unlike player.
* Stations always use the shared resources system, no matter what the default value is.
* Key is sector, because we use this table to make sure only one station is built per sector at a time.
* Zero Hour safety - do not rebuild anything when someone else has conquered the sector!
* Rebuild company's Trading Station if needed.
* Zero Hour safety - do not rebuild anything when someone else has conquered the sector!
* ZH 1.9 make sure that there is not already a second Outpost of the correct sector owner!
* ZH 1.9 make sure that there is not already a second Outpost of the correct sector owner!
* ZH 1.9 make sure that there is not already a second Outpost of the correct sector owner!
* ZH 1.9 make sure that there is not already a second Outpost of the correct sector owner!
* ZH 1.9 make sure that there is not already a second Outpost of the correct sector owner!
* ZH 1.9 make sure that there is not already a second Outpost of the correct sector owner!
* ZH 1.9 make sure that there is not already a second Outpost of the correct sector owner!
* ZH 1.9 make sure that there is not already a second Outpost of the correct sector owner!
* Rebuild Outpost if needed, free of charge. Also manage the debt system.
* Pay our debts!
* Build other stations if needed.
* Zero Hour Mod
* Don't go further if we have no available sectors.
* Build the resource-production factories we need.
* Zero Hour: we take wares on all trading stations into account

* no faction builds any more factories for the 1 resource that is the most available in the galaxy. Factions who specifically source from trading stations don't build factories for the 3 most available wares in the galaxy.

line.text: 's vanilla Mayhem 3 station construction routine attempted to build more '
' factories, but then realized that the faction can source it externally'

line.comment: * write to player logbook $t
* Build random product-production factories in sectors we didn't already build something in. We keep 1 slot for resource factories only.
* Limit stations per sector. Also see Mayhem.GameCreator.Populate.BuildFactoriesFromProduct.
* We create an asteroid if none found, because we want the AI to be able to build the mines it needed.

sval.val: s vanilla Mayhem 3 station construction routine attempted to build more
factories, but then realized that the faction can source it externally
AI will frequently build a new station with their resources. The process is instantaneous, unlike player.
Stations always use the shared resources system, no matter what the default value is.
Key is sector, because we use this table to make sure only one station is built per sector at a time.
Zero Hour safety - do not rebuild anything when someone else has conquered the sector!
Rebuild company's Trading Station if needed.
Zero Hour safety - do not rebuild anything when someone else has conquered the sector!
ZH 1.9 make sure that there is not already a second Outpost of the correct sector owner!

Rebuild Outpost if needed, free of charge. Also manage the debt system.
Pay our debts!
Build other stations if needed.
Zero Hour Mod
Don't go further if we have no available sectors.
Build the resource-production factories we need.
Zero Hour: we take wares on all trading stations into account

no faction builds any more factories for the 1 resource that is the most available in the galaxy. Factions who specifically source from trading stations don't build factories for the 3 most available wares in the galaxy.
write to player logbook $t
Build random product-production factories in sectors we didn't already build something in. We keep 1 slot for resource factories only.
Limit stations per sector. Also see Mayhem.GameCreator.Populate.BuildFactoriesFromProduct.
We create an asteroid if none found, because we want the AI to be able to build the mines it needed.
